title: Simulation-Based Power System Experimental Education: Advanced Design Utilizing Remote Laboratories

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic electrical engineering and power system theory
context.additional_context: Simulation-based remote lab education to address post-COVID-19 non-face-to-face experimental learning needs, applying low-cost solutions in university campus equipment-limited contexts. Designed with hands-on practice using PowerWorld Simulator and textbook case studies.

learning_goals: Short-circuit current analysis and power flow calculations can be performed using power system simulation tools.
Simulation results can be verified and interpreted by comparing them with textbook theories and actual experimental data.
Design ability and experimental analysis competencies can be demonstrated through project deliverables, meeting ABET learning outcome criteria.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
